00002 //! \file *********************************************************************
00003 //!
00004 //! \brief Process USB device enumeration requests header file.
00005 //!
00006 //!  This file contains the USB endpoint 0 management routines corresponding to
00007 //!  the standard enumeration process (refer to chapter 9 of the USB
00008 //!  specification.
00009 //!  This file calls routines of the usb_specific_request.c file for non-standard
00010 //!  request management.
00011 //!  The enumeration parameters (descriptor tables) are contained in the
00012 //!  usb_descriptors.c file.
00013 //!
00014 //! - Compiler:           IAR EWAVR and GNU GCC for AVR
00015 //! - Supported devices:  AT90USB1287, AT90USB1286, AT90USB647, AT90USB646
00016 //!
00017 //! \author               Atmel Corporation: http://www.atmel.com \n
00018 //!                       Support and FAQ: http://support.atmel.no/
00019 //!
00020 //! ***************************************************************************
00021

00049 #ifndef _USB_STANDARD_REQUEST_H_
00050 #define _USB_STANDARD_REQUEST_H_

00059 //_____ S T A N D A R D    D E F I N I T I O N S ___________________________

00061 //! @defgroup std_request USB device standard requests decoding
00062 //! @{
00063 
00064 
00065 
00066         // Device State
00067 #define ATTACHED                          0
00068 #define POWERED                           1
00069 #define DEFAULT                           2
00070 #define ADDRESSED                         3
00071 #define CONFIGURED                        4
00072 #define SUSPENDED                         5
00073 
00074 #define USB_REMOTE_WAKEUP       1
00075 #define OTG_B_HNP_ENABLE        3
00076 #define OTG_A_HNP_SUPPORT       4
00077 #define OTG_A_ALT_HNP_SUPPORT   5
00078 
00079 
00080 //_____ D E C L A R A T I O N ______________________________________________
00081 
00082    //! @brief Returns true when device connected and correctly enumerated with an host.
00083    //! The device high level application should tests this before performing any applicative requests
00084 #define Is_device_enumerated()            ((usb_configuration_nb!=0)   ? TRUE : FALSE)
00085 #define Is_device_not_enumerated()        ((usb_configuration_nb!=0)   ? FALSE : TRUE)
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089 
00090 //! @brief This function reads the SETUP request sent to the default control endpoint
00091 //! and calls the appropriate function. When exiting of the usb_read_request
00092 //! function, the device is ready to manage the next request.
00093 //!
00094 //! If the received request is not supported or a none USB standard request, the function
00095 //! will call for custom decoding function in usb_specific_request module.
00096 //!
00097 //! @param none
00098 //!
00099 //! @return none
00100 //! @note list of supported requests:
00101 //! SETUP_GET_DESCRIPTOR
00102 //! SETUP_GET_CONFIGURATION
00103 //! SETUP_SET_ADDRESS
00104 //! SETUP_SET_CONFIGURATION
00105 //! SETUP_CLEAR_FEATURE
00106 //! SETUP_SET_FEATURE
00107 //! SETUP_GET_STATUS
00108 //!
00109 void    usb_process_request( void);
00110 
00111 //! @brief This function manages the remote wakeup generation to wake up the host controlle.
00112 //!
00113 //! If the received request is not supported or a none USB standard request, the function
00114 //! will call for custom decoding function in usb_specific_request module.
00115 //!
00116 //! @param none
00117 //!
00118 //! @return none
00119 //!
00120 void     usb_generate_remote_wakeup(void);
00121 
00122 extern  U8   usb_configuration_nb;
00123 extern  U8   remote_wakeup_feature;
00124 
00125 
00126 #if (USE_DEVICE_SN_UNIQUE==ENABLE)
00127 extern  U8   f_get_serial_string;
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 //! @}
